name: Agodi Gardens
description: A lush botanical garden with water features, picnic areas, and playgrounds.

name: Mapo Hall
description: Historic town hall built in 1929, symbolizing Ibadan's political heritage.

name: Sango Festival
description: Annual celebration honoring Sango, the Yoruba god of thunder, with dance and rituals.

name: Aso Ofi
description: Handwoven Yoruba textile known for its vibrant colors and cultural significance.

name: Bower's Tower
description: A panoramic viewpoint offering stunning views of Ibadan city from the top.

name: Old Oyo National Park
description: A protected area rich in wildlife, history, and archaeological sites.

name: Ibadan Cultural Centre
description: A hub for Yoruba arts, music, and traditional performances.

name: Oke-Ogun Festival
description: Celebration of unity and heritage among the Oke-Ogun communities.

name: Irefin Palace
description: Historic palace of the Irefin family, showcasing traditional Yoruba architecture.

name: Aleshinloye Market
description: A bustling market known for local crafts, fabrics, and fresh produce.

name: Oyo Mesi Council
description: Council of chiefs who advise the Alaafin and uphold Yoruba customs.

name: Eleyele Lake
description: A serene lake ideal for fishing, boating, and relaxation.

name: Beere Roundabout
description: A central junction with deep historical and cultural relevance.

name: Oke-Ado Mosque
description: One of the oldest mosques in Ibadan, reflecting Islamic heritage.

name: Iseyin Weaving Village
description: A community of artisans preserving the tradition of handwoven Aso Ofi.
